title: A Mamba-based Network for Semi-supervised Singing Melody Extraction Using Confidence Binary Regularization
author: Xiaoliang He (School of Comp. Science & Technology Donghua University), Kangjie Dong (School of Comp. Science & Technology Donghua University), Jingkai Cao (School of Comp. Science & Technology Donghua University), Shuai Yu (School of Comp. Science & Technology Donghua University), Wei Li (School of Comp. Science & Technology Fudan University), Yi Yu (Grad. School of Adv. Science & Eng. Hiroshima University), ...
relevance_why: This paper introduces a semi-supervised learning approach for music information retrieval, which could enhance audio-based systems and methods relevant to Haohe Liu's research in audio generation and signal processing.
background: Singing melody extraction seeks to isolate the fundamental frequency from polyphonic music, which is vital for music information retrieval applications.
contribution: This paper introduces a mamba-based network for semi-supervised singing melody extraction to address the inefficiencies of existing transformer-based methods, achieving improved extraction accuracy.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods often rely on transformer architectures that have quadratic computational costs and require large labeled datasets.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves efficiency by leveraging a mamba-based architecture that processes input spectrograms with linear complexity and introduces confidence binary regularization to enhance learning from unlabeled data.

key_innovation: The use of a coarse-to-fine method in the note-f0 decoder simulates musical performance characteristics and utilizes confidence binary regularization to further improve performance with limited labeled data.
real_world_impact: This research could significantly enhance music information retrieval applications like melody extraction, potentially leading to more effective music recognition systems and improved user experiences.
limitations: No explicit limitations were mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.mamba-based network: **Mamba-based network** refers to a computational model that achieves linear complexity in processing input data, inspired by the efficiency of the vision mamba architecture.
new_terms.confidence binary regularization: **Confidence binary regularization** is a technique that encourages consistent predictions across augmented versions of the input data, promoting the use of both labeled and unlabeled data for better model training.
